{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3561436,"name":"allison zhang","username":"sink","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sink/{size}/237947_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T03:25:16.875Z","cooked":"

I have been trying to use vision pose estimation to drive to and score reliably on the nearest reef face. It works in two steps: first, drive to a pose a certain distance behind the tag. second, drive to the scoring location while going to a setpoint on our scoring mech. We’re using YAGSL’s driveToPose method.

Sometimes, just sometimes, it cancels after the first step. I have no idea why :(. I think it tries to do the second step because the setpoint command says it was interrupted.

log output when workie

image1920×544 132 KB

log output when no workie

image1920×474 109 KB

github

Bindings.java line 142

It’s possible you’re getting a false input from the other controllers, e.g. an intermittent POV reading on the operator controller could result in the elevator open loop command being run and interrupting the pidarmandelev command. I would go through and instrument the other commands that require the arm and elevator to find out what command is causing the interruption.

it consistently stops at the first pose so i doubt it. plus the command scheduler didn’t seem to show any other commands that could interrupt.

still i’ll definitely look into possible undesired controller inputs when i get the robot

also, here’s a video that i should’ve sent before haha IMG_4641.MOV - Google Drive (first and third stopped at i believe the spot the setpoint starts; second worked)
